ScoringRubric.name: score_chat
ScoringRubric.Description: Evaluates the quality of a chat transcript as a weighted sum of five factors. For each factor, assign a score of 0, 25, 50, 75, or 100 based on the provided levels. The final score_chat is the weighted sum of these scores.

Factor.name: Resolution Quality
Factor.Description: Measures the effectiveness and accuracy of the solution provided to the user's core issue.

ScoringLevels.Level: Full, accurate, and effective resolution achieved.
Largely resolved with only minor omissions.
Partial resolution; significant issues remain unresolved.
Inaccurate information provided or solution failed.
No resolution offered or attempted.

Factor.name: Interaction Efficiency
Factor.Description: Assesses the timeliness and conciseness of the conversation, minimizing effort for all parties.

ScoringLevels.Level: Highly efficient, prompt, and focused with no wasted messages.
Generally efficient with minor, acceptable delays.
Prolonged due to noticeable delays or repetitive questions.
Significantly inefficient with long waits and confusion.
Extremely inefficient and frustratingly slow.

Factor.name: Communication & Tone
Factor.Description: Evaluates the clarity, professionalism, grammar, and interpersonal tone of the agent.

ScoringLevels.Level: Crystal clear, professional, empathetic, and grammatically flawless.
Clear and professional with minor, non-impactful errors.
Understandable but contained several errors; tone was neutral.
Difficult to understand; tone was unprofessional or impatient.
Incomprehensible, unprofessional, or rude.

Factor.name: Process Adherence
Factor.Description: Measures compliance with required company protocols, such as greetings, verification, and disclosures.

ScoringLevels.Level: Flawlessly followed all required procedures.
Followed key procedures with only a minor deviation.
Missed a significant procedural step.
Missed multiple significant procedures or created a risk.
Complete disregard for established processes.

Factor.name: Engagement & Rapport
Factor.Description: Assesses the agent's ability to build a positive connection with the user through personalization and empathy.

ScoringLevels.Level: Actively built strong rapport and personalized the interaction.
Made a good effort to build rapport and show empathy.
Professional but impersonal; no attempt to build rapport.
Responses were robotic and scripted, showing no engagement.
Disengaged, creating a negative and disconnected experience.
